workflow.name: replace_surface_construction
workflow.description: Replaces the construction of all surface & sub surface objects matching a specified construction with new construction. The construction to replace with must already exist in the model.

argument.display_name: Pick a construction from the model to be replaced in utilised surfaces and sub surfaces.
argument.name: old_construction
choice_display_names: Trp LoE (e2=e5=.1) Clr 3mm/13mm Arg - PHIUS2018 Climate Zone 5A

variables.display_name: Pick a construction from the model to be replaced in utilised surfaces and sub surfaces.
variables.display_name_short: Pick a construction from the model to be replaced in utilised surfaces and sub surfaces.

argument.display_name: Pick construction from the model to be used for replacement.
argument.name: new_construction
choice_display_names: Trp LoE (e2=e5=.1) Clr 3mm/13mm Arg - PHIUS2018 Climate Zone 5A

variables.display_name: Pick construction from the model to be used for replacement.
variables.display_name_short: Pick construction from the model to be used for replacement.

workflow.name: resize_existing_windows_to_match_a_given_wwr
workflow.display_name: Resize existing windows to match a given WWR
workflow.measure_definition_display_name: Resize existing windows to match a given WWR
workflow.description:
This measure aims to resize all of the existing windows in order to produce a specified, user-input, window to wall ratio.
The windows will be resized around their centroid.
It should be noted that this measure should work in all cases when DOWNSIZING the windows (which is often the need given the 40% WWR imposed as baseline by ASHRAE Appendix G).
If you aim to increase the area, please note that this could result in subsurfaces being larger than their parent surface

arguments.display_name: Only affect surfaces that have boundary condition = "Outdoor"?
arguments.name: check_outdoors

argument.display_name: Skip Resize existing windows to match a given WWR
argument.name: __SKIP__

variables.display_name: Skip Resize existing windows to match a given WWR

workflow.name: reduce_lighting_loads_by_percentage
workflow.description: The lighting system in this building uses more power per area than is required with the latest lighting technologies.  Replace the lighting system with a newer, more efficient lighting technology.  Newer technologies provide the same amount of light but use less energy in the process.

arguments.display_name: Apply the Measure to a Specific Space Type or to the Entire Model
arguments.name: space_type

arguments.display_name: Increase in Material and Installation Cost for Lighting per Floor Area
arguments.name: material_and_installation_cost

arguments.display_name: Increase in Demolition Costs for Lighting per Floor Area
arguments.name: demolition_cost

arguments.display_name: Demolition Costs Occur During Initial Construction
arguments.name: demo_cost_initial_const

arguments.display_name: Increase O & M Costs for Lighting per Floor Area
arguments.name: om_cost

argument.display_name: Skip Reduce Lighting Loads by Percentage
argument.name: __SKIP__

variables.display_name: Skip Reduce Lighting Loads by Percentage

workflow.name: reduce_space_infiltration_by_percentage
workflow.description: This measure will reduce space infiltration rates by the requested percentage. A cost per square foot of building area can be added to the model.

arguments.display_name: Apply the Measure to a Specific Space Type or to the Entire Model.
arguments.name: space_type

arguments.display_name: Alter constant temperature and wind speed coefficients.
arguments.name: alter_coef

arguments.display_name: Increase in Material and Installation Costs for Building per Affected Floor Area
arguments.name: material_and_installation_cost

arguments.display_name: O & M Costs for Construction per Affected Floor Area
arguments.name: om_cost

workflow.name: openstudio_results
workflow.description: This measure creates high level tables and charts pulling both from model inputs and EnergyPlus results. It has building level information as well as detail on space types, thermal zones, HVAC systems, envelope characteristics, and economics. Click the heading above a chart to view a table of the chart data.

arguments.display_name: Which Unit System do you want to use?
arguments.name: units

arguments.display_name: Report monthly fuel and enduse breakdown to registerValue
arguments.name: reg_monthly_details
